name: Southeast Asian Shrimp And Grapefruit Salad
keywords: dairy-free, gluten-free, nut-free, vegetarian, grapefruit, mesclun, shrimp, main course
recipeIngredient: 3 tablespoons nam pla (fish sauce) or soy sauce
6 cups lettuce or mesclun, washed and dried
2 grapefruit, peeled and sectioned, tough white pith removed, each section cut in half
Minced chilies or dried red pepper flakes, optional

recipeInstructions.text: Put shrimp in a saucepan with salted water to cover; bring to a boil, then turn off heat and let sit for 5 minutes, or until shrimp are opaque in center. (Alternatively, grill or saute, sprinkling shrimp with salt as they cook.) Cool in refrigerator or under cold running water, then peel (and devein if you like). Cut shrimp in half if they're large.
Combine nam pla or soy sauce with 2 tablespoons water, sugar and lime juice, and blend or whisk until smooth.

Arrange the lettuce on 4 plates; top each portion with a few grapefruit pieces, some shrimp, and the mint and cilantro; drizzle with the dressing, then sprinkle with a little of the minced chilies and chopped peanuts if you like, or pass them at the table.

video.name: Southeast Asian Shrimp Salad
video.description: Mark Bittman adds grapefruit to a shrimp salad with fish sauce, sugar, mint and cilantro.
